title: Nail-biting moment boy jumps out of way of 90mph train onto platform
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

This is the terrifying moment that a boy jumped out of the way with just fractions of a second to spare.

The youngster was seen running across the tracks at Pyle Station, Bridgend, South Wales, before urging friends to join him.

British Transport Police have now issued footage of the incident as a warning to others and to try and track down those involved.

The boy just about managed to get onto the platform in time as the driver of the train slammed on the emergency brakes of the 90mph train.

He then looks like he almost stumbles off the platform but manages to get his balance back and moves away from the edge.

The incident happened at 11.17pm on October 8.

The youngster scrambles onto the platform as he sees the train heading directly towards him (Picture: British Transport Police)

He only just managed to get onto the platform in time, avoiding almost certain death (Picture: British Transport Police)

The train slammed on his emergency brakes while the boy celebrated, gesturing towards his friends (Picture: British Transport Police)

Inspector Mike Edwards said: ‘The railway is a highly dangerous environment and anyone seeking to trespass on the line is not only committing an offence but are risking their lives.

‘This footage is deeply concerning, quite frankly I am surprised our officers were not called to a fatality that evening – this young man was seconds from tragedy.

‘Trespassing is no joke and we urge people to respect the railway and its dangers.’

Police officers will now work at Pyle station to spread a rail safety message to prevent a tragedy from occurring.
